paw_structure.water¶

Water complex detection.

Find configurations that deviate from the normal molecule structure.

Main routine is water_find_parallel().

Dependencies:

functools miniutils numpy pandas neighbors utility Snap

water_find_parallel(root, snapshots, id1, id2)

Find water complexes for multiple snapshots of atomic configurations.

water_load(root[, ext])

Load information previously saved by water_save().

water_save(root, snapshots, id1, id2, cut[, ext])

Save results to file.

water_single(snap, id1, id2, cut)

Find water complex of a single snapshot of atomic positions.

XXX REFERENCE TO ALGORITHM EXPLANATION XXX

paw_structure.water.water_find_parallel(root, snapshots, id1, id2, cut=1.4)¶

Find water complexes for multiple snapshots of atomic configurations.

Parameters

  • root (str) – root name of the files

  • snapshots (list[Snap]) – list of snapshots containing the atomic information

  • id1 (str) – identifier for atom used as center (e.g. ‘O_’)

  • id2 (str) – identifier for atoms as possible neighbors (e.g. ‘H_’)

  • cut (float) – cutoff distance for neighbor search

Returns

list of snapshots containing water complexes

Return type

list[Snap]

Parallelization based on multiprocessing.

paw_structure.water.water_load(root, ext='.water')¶

Load information previously saved by water_save().

Parameters

  • root (str) – root name for the file to be loaded

  • ext (str, optional) – default “.water” - extension for the file to be loaded: name = root + ext

Returns

list of snapshots containing water complexes

Return type

list[Snap]

Note

Reading is line sensitive. Do not alter the output file before loading.

paw_structure.water.water_save(root, snapshots, id1, id2, cut, ext='.water')¶

Save results to file.

XXX REFERENCE TO EXPLANATION OF .water FILE FORMAT XXX

Parameters

  • root (str) – root name for saving file

  • snapshots (list[Snap]) – list of snapshots containing the water complexes

  • id1 (str) – identifier for atom used as center (e.g. ‘O_’)

  • id2 (str) – identifier for atoms as possible neighbors (e.g. ‘H_’)

  • cut (float) – cutoff distance for neighbor search

  • ext (str, optional) – default “.water” - extension for the saved file: name = root + ext

paw_structure.water.water_single(snap, id1, id2, cut)¶

Find water complex of a single snapshot of atomic positions.

Parameters

  • snap (Snap) – single snapshot containing the atomic information

  • id1 (str) – identifier for atom used as center (e.g. ‘O_’)

  • id2 (str) – identifier for atoms as possible neighbors (e.g. ‘H_’)

  • cut (float) – cutoff distance for neighbor search

Returns

snapshot containing water complexes

Return type

Snap

Note

Refine detection criteria.
